data.event: The town was settled in the late 1860s, with a Post Office opening on 15 March 1867 (known until 24 April 1867) as Redgate.

event.title: discovered gold in the area in 1866

data.event: The current name either derives from Alexandra of Denmark when the shire was given a statue of her, or from three men named Alexander (Alesander, McGregor, Alexander Don, and Alexander Luckie) who discovered gold in the area in 1866.

event.title: arrived as a branch line of the Mansfield railway line in 1909

data.event: The railway to Alexandra arrived as a branch line of the Mansfield railway line in 1909, and closed on 18 November 1978.
The railway to Alexandra arrived as a branch line of the Mansfield railway line in 1909, and closed on 18 November 1978.

event.title: 2012, the closed rail line was used

data.event: In 2012, the closed rail line was used as part of the route for the 134 km long Great Victorian Rail Trail.
